thread.title: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi cuts IPO target to $70 billion to $80 billion - MarketWatch

author: Dan Strumpf
title: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi cuts IPO target to $70 billion to $80 billion - MarketWatch
text:
Published: May 8, 2018 8:29 a.m. ET Share
Current valuation range is lower than the $100 billion previously discussed in what’s shaping up to be largest tech IPO this year Reuters IPO is expected to be the world’s biggest by a tech company this year.
By Dan Strumpf Julie Steinberg
HONG KONG—Xiaomi Corp., the Chinese smartphone maker that is gearing up for a Hong Kong initial public offering, is targeting a valuation of between $70 billion and $80 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.
The company’s upcoming IPO, revealed last week in a filing with Hong Kong’s stock exchange , is expected to be the world’s biggest by a tech company this year.
The company didn’t disclose details about the offering size or the company’s expected valuation in its filing. However, the current valuation range is lower than the $100 billion that was previously discussed, according to people familiar with the matter.
The company is aiming to raise at least $10 billion in the deal, according to people familiar with the matter.
